snippet: Doctors seeking to stem the Ebola epidemic disagree on whether most patients in West Africa should, or can, be given intravenous hydration, a standard therapy in developed countries.
abstract: Medical community is engaged in debate over use of intravenous hydration on patients infected by Ebola in West African countries, treatment that many attribute to the higher survival rate of patients treated in the West; debate comes at time when focus of aid efforts is shifting from stopping spread of disease, which seems to be under control, toward saving lives of those infected.
lead_paragraph: Doctors seeking to stem the Ebola epidemic disagree on whether most patients in West Africa should, or can, be given intravenous hydration, a standard therapy in developed countries.

headline.main: Ebola Doctors Are Divided on IV Therapy in Africa
headline.print_headline: Ebola Doctors Are Divided on IV Therapy in Africa

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
